headline: Exxon Mobil Faces Supreme Court Climate Case And Boardroom Transition Risks
summary: The U.S. Supreme Court has agreed to hear climate litigation against Exxon Mobil (NYSE:XOM) brought by Boulder, Colorado. Exxon Mobil has announced that board director Jeffrey W. Ubben, known for his focus on environmental strategy and returns, plans to leave the board. Exxon Mobil, a major integrated oil and gas company, is at the center of ongoing debates around energy security, emissions, and capital allocation in the sector. The Supreme Court's decision to review climate claims against...

headline: The Stocks Unscathed by Today’s Selloff
summary: The unlikely star of the stock market lately? Consumer staples stocks. The companies that sell groceries, cigarettes and household products were mostly unscathed by Monday’s selloff. Stocks like Mondelez International, the company behind Oreos and Ritz crackers, and toothpaste maker Colgate-Palmolive were among the top performers in the S&P 500.

headline: US Supreme Court to hear Exxon and Suncor bid to toss Boulder's climate suit
summary: WASHINGTON, Feb 23 (Reuters) - The U. Supreme Court agreed on Monday to hear a bid by ExxonMobil and Suncor Energy to scuttle a lawsuit brought ‌by officials in Boulder, Colorado that seeks to hold the oil companies liable ‌for helping to fuel climate change.

headline: US Supreme Court to hear Exxon bid for compensation from Cuba
summary: Supreme Court will consider on Monday the scope of a law that lets American companies seek compensation for property seized by Cuba in cases involving ExxonMobil and cruise operators being argued at a ‌time when President Donald Trump's administration is ramping up pressure on the Cuban government.
